series_title.en: I Rescued a Lost Little Girl, and Now the Beautiful Exchange Student Next Door Won't Stop Visiting!

speaking_to.Charlotte Bennett: initially polite, gradually more casual as they grow closer

emotional_shifts.embarrassment: becomes flustered, stutters, avoids eye contact

keigo.notes: Maintains a polite distance with most, but shows warmth and casualness with those he trusts or cares for deeply.

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Standard short hair, typical high school uniform, often has a thoughtful or slightly flustered expression, sometimes seen with a slightly withdrawn posture.

青柳明人.notes: Reserved, thoughtful, kind, responsible, self-sacrificing due to a past event, intelligent (good student, proficient in English), easily flustered by romantic attention.

1b97.relationship_to_others: Best friend with Saionji Akira; neighbor and developing romantic interest with Charlotte Bennett; surrogate older brother figure to Emma; student of Miyu-sensei.

speaking_to.Charlotte Bennett: initially polite, gradually more casual as they grow closer

emotional_shifts.embarrassment: becomes flustered, stutters, avoids eye contact

keigo_switch.notes: Maintains a polite distance with most, but shows warmth and casualness with those he trusts or cares for deeply.

1b97.character_arc: Overcoming past burdens and learning to accept happiness and the affection of others, particularly Charlotte and Emma.

1294.relationship_to_others: Charlotte's boyfriend, Emma's adopted father figure, Saionji Akira's best friend, Shinonome Karin's twin brother, Hanazawa Miyu's student, Sasagawa Marin's student.

speaking_to.Charlotte Bennett: polite (さん), becoming more casual and affectionate as their relationship deepens; often speaks English with her.
speaking_to.Hanazawa Miyu: polite, respectful, but can be subtly teasing or challenging.
speaking_to.Shinonome Karin: gentle, encouraging; later uses her given name (華凜) and accepts 'Onii-chan' (お兄ちゃん) in private.
speaking_to.Classmates: generally polite/neutral, but can be dismissive to maintain his 'disliked' persona.

emotional_shifts.anger: Can become terse or withdraw, especially when confronted with his past.
emotional_shifts.affection: Becomes softer, more gentle, especially with Charlotte and Emma.
emotional_shifts.embarrassment: Can become flustered, stammer, or avert gaze.

keigo_switch.notes: Maintains a polite distance with most, using 'san' or 'sensei', but drops to casual with close friends like Akira. Uses English extensively with Charlotte and Emma due to their background.

1294.character_arc: Overcoming past trauma and self-sacrificing tendencies, learning to accept help and love from others, accepting his new family (Charlotte, Emma, Shinonome), and allowing himself to be happy.

17fb.relationship_to_others: Charlotte Bennett (girlfriend), Emma Bennett (adoptive daughter figure), Saionji Akira (best friend, soccer teammate), Hanazawa Miyu (homeroom teacher, confidante), Shinonome (adopted younger sister), Claire (Emma's friend, guardian figure), Kousaka Kaede (middle school junior, former soccer club manager), Shimizu (classmate, Charlotte's friend).

speaking_to.Charlotte Bennett: casual (affectionate, sometimes slightly more formal when being gentle or reassuring)
speaking_to.Kousaka Kaede: polite, apologetic (due to past), later more casual/friendly

keigo_switch.emotional_shifts: Can become more formal or gentle when trying to comfort Charlotte; becomes firm when defending Charlotte or Akira; apologetic when discussing his past.

17fb.character_arc: Continues to overcome past trauma, strengthens his relationship with Charlotte and Emma, confronts his past with Kaede, uses his soccer skills to protect Charlotte's reputation and his own, makes a decision about his future in soccer.

シャーロット・ベネット.category: Foreign exchange student, neighbor, developing romantic interest, relies on him for support with Emma.

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: polite (keigo), becoming slightly less formal as intimacy grows

emotional_shifts.embarrassment: blushes, stutters, covers mouth, looks down

keigo.notes: Her politeness is a consistent trait, reflecting her upbringing, but she shows vulnerability and playfulness with those she trusts.

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Long, straight hair, elegant gestures, friendly and sometimes mischievous smile, often seen in school uniform or casual home attire (sometimes resembling pajamas), tends to blush easily.

シャーロット・ベネット.notes: Elegant, friendly, kind, sincere, a bit mischievous, highly proficient in Japanese, skilled at Japanese cooking, initially reserved but opens up, easily embarrassed, especially by romantic topics.

1b97.relationship_to_protagonist: Foreign exchange student, neighbor, developing romantic interest, relies on him for support with Emma.
1b97.relationship_to_others: Older sister to Emma; classmate of Aoyagi Akihito and Saionji Akira; student of Miyu-sensei.

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: polite (keigo), becoming slightly less formal as intimacy grows

emotional_shifts.embarrassment: blushes, stutters, covers mouth, looks down

keigo_switch.notes: Her politeness is a consistent trait, reflecting her upbringing, but she shows vulnerability and playfulness with those she trusts.

1b97.character_arc: Adjusting to life in Japan, deepening her bond with Akihito and Emma, and navigating her feelings.

1294.relationship_to_protagonist: Love interest, girlfriend (by end of volume), Emma's older sister.
1294.relationship_to_others: Emma's older sister, Shimizu Arisa's friend, Hanazawa Miyu's student, Saionji Akira's classmate.

keigo_switch.narration: polite/formal (when narrative is from her POV)
keigo_switch.internal_thoughts: casual, expressive, often includes exclamations of embarrassment or delight.

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: polite (青柳君), sometimes uses English; becomes more direct and affectionate after confessing.
speaking_to.Shimizu Arisa: polite (さん), becoming more casual and intimate as their friendship deepens.

emotional_shifts.embarrassment: Becomes flustered, stammers, blushes intensely, averts gaze, or hides her face/buries her face in Akihito's arm.
emotional_shifts.anger/frustration: Rarely shows, but can pout or express mild exasperation, especially with Emma or when Akihito is dense.

keigo_switch.notes: Maintains a consistently polite and formal register in Japanese, reflecting her upbringing and foreign status, but her English with Emma and Akihito is natural. Her internal thoughts reveal a more playful and passionate personality.

1294.character_arc: Learning to be more direct and courageous with her feelings, moving from dependence to mutual support in her relationship with Akihito, embracing her 'childish' side, and becoming a strong emotional pillar for Akihito.

17fb.relationship_to_protagonist: Girlfriend, deeply in love and devoted to him.
17fb.relationship_to_others: Emma Bennett (younger sister, very protective), Aoyagi Akihito (boyfriend), Claire (Emma's friend, also cares for her), Shimizu (close friend), Kiriyama (friend), Arazawa (friend), Kousaka Kaede (junior, becomes friendly).

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: polite, respectful, but increasingly casual and affectionate as their relationship deepens, especially when embarrassed, jealous, or expressing deep affection. Uses 'Akihito-kun'.

keigo_switch.emotional_shifts: Shifts to more direct or flustered speech when embarrassed, jealous, or expressing strong affection. Can become firm or assertive when defending Akihito or expressing her feelings about him.

17fb.character_arc: Becomes more open about her feelings and jealousy, deepens her relationship with Akihito, learns about and supports Akihito through his past trauma, becomes bolder in expressing her love and possessiveness.

anti_confusion_directives: Charlotte is the elder Bennett sister; do not map her as Emma.
Charlotte is taller and holds sisterly/guardian posture in shared scenes.

blood_related_siblings.japanese_name: シャーロット・ベネット

anti_confusion_directives: Emma is the younger Bennett sister; do not map her as Charlotte.
Emma is child-sized and calls Charlotte 'Lottie' (ロッティー).

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Small child with short hair and cat/beast-ear accessories; younger Bennett sister, often shown with innocent expressive gestures.

1294.relationship_to_protagonist: Charlotte's younger sister, Akihito's adopted daughter figure.

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: affectionate, demanding (抱っこ - 'hug me'), uses 'onii-chan' (おにいちゃん).
speaking_to.Charlotte Bennett: affectionate, but can be defiant or whiny.

emotional_shifts.sadness: Eyes well up with tears, pouts, makes weak pleading sounds.
emotional_shifts.happiness: Bright smiles, hugs, excited movements, humming.
emotional_shifts.anger/jealousy: Puffs out cheeks, hits chest (Akihito's), pulls clothes, can become violent (headbutting plushie).

keigo_switch.notes: Speaks almost exclusively in English. Her Japanese understanding is minimal. Her speech is characterized by its simplicity and directness, reflecting her age.

1294.character_arc: Adjusting to a new environment, forming bonds with Akihito and friends, learning social norms and sharing.

17fb.relationship_to_protagonist: Adoptive daughter figure to Akihito, very attached to him, calls him 'Onii-chan'.
17fb.relationship_to_others: Charlotte Bennett (older sister), Claire (best friend from daycare).

keigo_switch.emotional_shifts: Becomes sulky when denied something, excited when offered something fun, affectionate when praised or comforted.

17fb.character_arc: Turns five, learns new skills (soccer), strengthens friendship with Claire, continues to be a central figure in Akihito and Charlotte's lives, shows signs of growth (e.g., sharing Akihito).

西園寺彰.category: Best friend since elementary school, confidante.

keigo.notes: His casual and direct speech reflects his outgoing and sometimes thoughtless nature.

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Sportsman-like short hair, handsome face, energetic posture, often seen with a wide grin or a sulking, pouting expression.

西園寺彰.notes: Energetic, outgoing, friendly, handsome, athletic, excellent communicator, prone to acting impulsively, especially around girls, often the class mood-maker, but can be dense.

1b97.relationship_to_protagonist: Best friend since elementary school, confidante.
1b97.relationship_to_others: Classmate of Akihito and Charlotte; soccer player in youth league; student of Miyu-sensei.

keigo_switch.notes: His casual and direct speech reflects his outgoing and sometimes thoughtless nature.

1b97.character_arc: Remaining a supportive friend to Akihito, and potentially maturing in his approach to relationships.

1294.relationship_to_others: Akihito's best friend, Shinonome Karin's classmate (initially causes her fear), Hanazawa Miyu's student.

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: casual, friendly, sometimes exasperated or challenging.
speaking_to.Hanazawa Miyu: polite, but can be playful or make lighthearted complaints.
speaking_to.Shinonome Karin: initially loud and causes her fear, later tries to be gentler and more considerate.
speaking_to.Classmates: casual, friendly, takes a leadership role in class activities.

emotional_shifts.frustration: Can become exasperated, especially with Akihito's hidden talents or Miyu-sensei's teasing.

keigo_switch.notes: His speech is generally informal and direct, reflecting his close relationships and energetic personality. He is a 'mood maker' in the class.

1294.character_arc: Supporting Akihito, learning to be more considerate of Shinonome's shyness, and continuing to be a reliable friend.

17fb.relationship_to_protagonist: Best friend, former soccer teammate, rival in soccer, deeply loyal.
17fb.relationship_to_others: Aoyagi Akihito (best friend), Charlotte Bennett (friend, supportive of her relationship with Akihito), Shinonome (friend), Kousaka Kaede (middle school junior, holds complicated feelings due to past).

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: casual, friendly, sometimes challenging (in soccer context).
speaking_to.Hanazawa Miyu: respectful (but can be less so when angry or flustered).

keigo_switch.emotional_shifts: Becomes angry and confrontational when Akihito is insulted or his past is brought up. Can be sulky when Akihito doesn't follow his advice.

17fb.character_arc: Supports Akihito through school gossip, confronts his own soccer skills and pride in a match against Akihito, re-evaluates his path as a soccer player, expresses a desire to play with Akihito again.

1294.relationship_to_protagonist: Akihito's homeroom teacher, mentor figure, Sasagawa Marin's childhood friend.
1294.relationship_to_others: Akihito's homeroom teacher, Sasagawa Marin's childhood friend, Emma's temporary caretaker, principal's subordinate.

speaking_to.Students: authoritative, direct, sometimes with a hint of exasperation or teasing.
speaking_to.Sasagawa Marin: casual, teasing, can be stern or annoyed, but ultimately caring. Insists on 'Sasagawa-sensei' at school.

emotional_shifts.anger: Eyes narrow, tone becomes sharp, can make intimidating remarks.
emotional_shifts.amusement: Narrows eyes into a smile, or makes a 'niyari' (smirking) expression.
emotional_shifts.caring: Voice softens, offers practical advice or support.

keigo_switch.notes: Her speech is a mix of professional authority and personal familiarity, especially with Sasagawa-sensei. She uses direct language with students, often cutting through nonsense.

1294.character_arc: Subtly supporting Akihito and Charlotte's relationship, revealing more of her past through interactions with Sasagawa-sensei, acting as a reliable adult figure.

17fb.relationship_to_protagonist: Homeroom teacher, confidante, supportive figure who knows his past.
17fb.relationship_to_others: Aoyagi Akihito (student), Charlotte Bennett (student), Saionji Akira (student), Sasagawa-sensei (colleague, implied close relationship).

speaking_to.Students: authoritative, but also caring and sometimes teasing.
speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: direct, sometimes casual and jocular when discussing sensitive topics or offering personal advice.

keigo_switch.emotional_shifts: Can be stern when addressing misbehavior, but generally maintains a calm and supportive tone with Akihito.

17fb.character_arc: Guides Akihito through school challenges related to his relationship and past, offers strategic advice for the ball game tournament, provides emotional support.

17fb.relationship_to_protagonist: Adopted younger sister, very attached to Akihito, calls him 'Onii-chan', implied romantic feelings.
17fb.relationship_to_others: Aoyagi Akihito (adopted older brother), Charlotte Bennett (Akihito's girlfriend, seems to accept her), Saionji Akira (friend).

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: polite, respectful, but also affectionate and dependent. Uses 'Onii-chan'.

keigo_switch.emotional_shifts: Becomes more direct or insistent when expressing her attachment to Akihito or her worries. Can be shy when praised.

17fb.character_arc: Continues to be attached to Akihito, expresses her desire to spend time with him, shows concern for his well-being during the ball game tournament.

speaking_to.Aoyagi Akihito: timid, hesitant, uses simple 'yes' or 'no' answers.

emotional_shifts.fear: Body trembles, eyes well up with tears, tries to hide or retreat.

keigo_switch.notes: Her speech reflects her young age and emotional state, often characterized by fear or remorse.

1294.character_arc: Learning about sharing, empathy, and apologizing for mistakes.

17fb.relationship_to_protagonist: Emma's friend, Akihito acts as a guardian figure.
17fb.relationship_to_others: Emma Bennett (best friend from daycare), Charlotte Bennett (Emma's sister, also cares for her), Claire's mother (mother).

keigo_switch.emotional_shifts: Becomes excited when seeing animals or nature, shy when addressed directly, sad when Emma is upset.

17fb.character_arc: Learning Japanese, deepening friendship with Emma, experiences new activities with Akihito and Charlotte.

エマ.category: Rescued by Akihito, beloved 'Onii-chan' (older brother figure), playmate, very attached to him.

emotional_shifts.affection: clings to people, rubs face against them

keigo.notes: Her speech is typical of a young child, direct and focused on her immediate desires.

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Small stature, often seen wearing a beast-ear hood (pajamas), tends to cling to people she likes, wide-eyed innocent expression, pouts with puffed cheeks when unhappy, brightens with a wide smile when excited.

エマ.notes: Innocent, sweet, easily attached, playful, a bit stubborn when she wants something, usually loves cat videos, cries easily when startled or sad, very affectionate.

1b97.relationship_to_protagonist: Rescued by Akihito, beloved 'Onii-chan' (older brother figure), playmate, very attached to him.
1b97.relationship_to_others: Younger sister to Charlotte Bennett, doted upon.

emotional_shifts.affection: clings to people, rubs face against them

keigo_switch.notes: Her speech is typical of a young child, direct and focused on her immediate desires.

1b97.character_arc: Adapting to a new country and language, finding comfort and a sense of belonging with Akihito, and growing closer to her sister.

blood_related_siblings.japanese_name: シャーロット・ベネット

anti_confusion_directives: Emma is the younger Bennett sister; do not map her as Charlotte.
Emma is child-sized and calls Charlotte 'Lottie' (ロッティー).

美優先生.category: Homeroom teacher, observant of his personal life, knows about his past, likes to tease him.

keigo.notes: Her speech reflects her dual role as a strict teacher and a caring, albeit teasing, mentor.

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Beautiful appearance, professional attire, often has a stern or teasing expression, sometimes seen with a hand on her hip in an authoritative stance.

美優先生.notes: Beautiful, short-tempered, tomboyish, observant, caring towards her students (especially Akihito), enjoys teasing, but also offers genuine advice.

1b97.relationship_to_protagonist: Homeroom teacher, observant of his personal life, knows about his past, likes to tease him.
1b97.relationship_to_others: Colleague of Hanazawa-sensei and Sasagawa-sensei; teacher to Akihito, Akira, and Charlotte.

keigo_switch.notes: Her speech reflects her dual role as a strict teacher and a caring, albeit teasing, mentor.

1b97.character_arc: Supporting Akihito's emotional growth and subtly guiding him towards happiness.

花澤先生.discovered_in: (迷子になっていた幼女を助けたら、お隣に住む美少女留学生が家に遊びに来るようになった件について (1)_20260212_1b97

keigo.notes: Her speech is often lighthearted and aimed at provoking a reaction, especially from Miyu-sensei.

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Professional attire, often seen with a sly or amused smile, composed posture.

花澤先生.notes: Teasing, observant, seems to know about Akihito's situation and Miyu-sensei's personality.

1b97.relationship_to_others: Colleague of Miyu-sensei and Sasagawa-sensei; has a teasing relationship with Miyu-sensei.

keigo_switch.notes: Her speech is often lighthearted and aimed at provoking a reaction, especially from Miyu-sensei.

1b97.character_arc: Minor character, provides comedic relief and insight into Akihito's situation.

keigo.notes: His speech reflects his often-victim status in the teachers' office banter.

visual_identity_non_color.identity_summary: Not enough specific visual details, but implied to be less composed, often seen with a pouting or defeated expression, perhaps slightly disheveled when teased.

笹川先生.notes: Childlike (pouts), easily provoked, often on the receiving end of jokes, somewhat hapless.

1b97.relationship_to_others: Colleague of Miyu-sensei and Hanazawa-sensei; often the target of teasing and scolding.

keigo_switch.notes: His speech reflects his often-victim status in the teachers' office banter.

name_order.policy: Japanese surname-first order for Japanese characters.

translation_rules.style: Natural English prose matching the genre tone.
